tit.cmt: The Encyclopaedia of Shintoによったものです。 "inauspicious year"や"unlucky year"の訳もありますが、内容説明です。

sen.j: 厄年（やくどし）は、陰陽道で教宣されている、厄災が多く降りかかるとされる年齢のことである。
sen.e: As propagated by On'myodo (the traditions of Yin-Yang divination and astronomy), a person is believed to suffer misfortunes at an age of calamity.
sen.cmt: 陰陽道の説明はThe Encyclopaedia of Shintoによります。
sen.e: As propagated by On'myodo (the traditions of Yin-Yang divination and astronomy), a person is believed to suffer misfortunes during their age of calamity.
As propagated by Onmyodo (the traditions of Yin-Yang divination and astronomy), a person is believed to suffer misfortunes during their age of calamity.

sen.j: 平安時代にはすでに存在し、起源も曖昧だが根強い風習。
sen.e: The tradition of the calamitous ages, whose genesis is shrouded in obscurity, but which already existed in the Heian period, still runs deep in Japanese society.
sen.cmt: 「根強い」を動詞で表現したので、in Japanese societyを追加しました。
sen.e: The tradition of calamitous ages, whose genesis is shrouded in obscurity, but which already existed in the Heian period, still runs deep in Japanese society.
The tradition of calamitous ages, whose genesis is shrouded in obscurity, but which already existed in the Heian period, still runs deep in Japanese society.

sen.j: 一般的に男性と女性の厄年は異なる。
sen.e: Generally, the ages of calamity differ according to gender.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Generally, the ages of calamity differ according to gender.
Generally, the ages of calamity differ according to gender.

sen.j: 本厄は男性の場合は、数え年で25歳、42歳、61歳。
sen.e: For men, they are the ages of twenty-five, forty-two, and sixty-one in Japanese age reckoning;
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For men, they are the ages of twenty-five, forty-two, and sixty-one in Japanese age reckoning;
For men, they are the ages of 25, 42, and 61 in Japanese age reckoning;

sen.j: 女性の場合は19歳、33歳、37歳とされている。
sen.e: for women, the ages of nineteen, thirty-three and thirty-seven.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: for women, the ages of nineteen, thirty-three and thirty-seven.
for women, the ages of 19, 33 and 61.

sen.j: 特に男性の42歳、女性の33歳は大厄と呼ばれ、凶事や災難に遭う率が非常に高いので十分な警戒を要するとされている。
sen.e: The age of forty-two for men and of thirty-three for women in particular are called the age of major calamity, at which they are advised to be amply vigilant as they are very likely to suffer adversities and misfortunes.

The age of forty-two for men and of thirty-three for women in particular are called the age of major calamity, at which they are advised to be amply vigilant as they are very likely to suffer adversities and misfortunes.

The age of 42 for men and of 33 for women in particular are called the age of major calamity, at which they are advised to be amply vigilant as they are very likely to suffer adversities and misfortunes.

sen.j: なお数え年は、誕生日前の場合は +2歳、誕生日を迎えている場合は +1歳を足して計算する。
sen.e: In Japanese age reckoning, two is added to one's age before his birthday, or one after it.
In Japanese age reckoning, two is added to one's age before his birthday, or one after it.
In Japanese age reckoning, two is added to one's age before his birthday, or one after it.

sen.j: いずれの厄年にもその前後1年間に前厄（厄の前兆が現れるとされる年）・後厄（厄のおそれが薄らいでいくとされる年）の期間がある。
sen.e: A period of one year immediately before and after each age of calamity is called maeyaku (pre-age of calamity at which portents of calamity may emerge) and ato-yaku (post-age of calamity at which the fear of calamity may recede), respectively.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: A period of one year immediately before and after each age of calamity is called maeyaku (pre-age of calamity at which portents of calamity may emerge) and ato-yaku (post-age of calamity at which the fear of calamity may recede), respectively.

A period of one year immediately before and after each age of calamity is called maeyaku (pre-age of calamity at which portents of calamity may emerge) and ato-yaku (post-age of calamity at which the fear of calamity may recede), respectively.

sen.j: 本厄と同様に注意すべきとされる。
sen.e: It is advisable to be as careful at these ages as at the ages of calamity.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is advisable to be as careful at these ages as at the ages of calamity.
It is advisable to be as careful at these ages as at the ages of calamity.

sen.j: また、地域や宗派などによっては61歳の還暦を男女共通で厄年とする場合もある。
sen.e: In some regions or denominations the age of sixty-one called kanreki (at which a person's longevity is celebrated) is taken as the age of calamity for both men and women.
sen.cmt: 還暦は文脈上とくに重要な概念ではないので、長寿祝いと概念の説明にとどめました。
sen.e: In some regions or denominations the age of sixty-one called kanreki (at which a person's longevity is celebrated) is taken as the age of calamity for both men and women.
In some regions or denominations the age of 61called kanreki (at which a person's longevity is celebrated) is taken as the age of calamity for both men and women.

sen.j: 19歳、25歳は青春期に当たり、また33歳、42歳は青春期を過ぎ、中高年期への過渡期に当たる。
sen.e: People of the ages of nineteen and twenty-five are in the period of youth and of the ages of thirty-three and forty-two in the period of mid-to-older life transition after their youth.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: People of the ages of nineteen and twenty-five are in the period of youth and of the ages of thirty-three and forty-two in the period of mid-to-older life transition after their youth.
People of the ages of 19 and 25 are in the period of youth and of the ages of 33 and 42 in the period of mid-to-older life transition after their youth.

sen.j: それらは人生のうちでも曲がり角である。
sen.e: They face turning points in their lives.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They face turning points in their lives.
They face turning points in their lives.

sen.j: 男性の場合は社会的にも責任が重くなり、それゆえ精神的・肉体的にも疲労などが多い。
sen.e: Assuming heavy social responsibilities, men often suffer from mental and physical exhaustion.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Assuming heavy social responsibilities, men often suffer from mental and physical exhaustion.
Assuming heavy social responsibilities, men often suffer from mental and physical exhaustion.

sen.j: 女性の場合は子育てあるいは主婦として非常に多忙な時期でもあり、不慮の事故やけが、病気なども起こりやすいとされている。
sen.e: Women are prone to accidents, injuries or illnesses, busy with raising children and household affairs.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Women are prone to accidents, injuries or illnesses, busy with raising children and household affairs.
Women are prone to accidents, injuries or illnesses, busy with raising children and household affairs.

sen.j: それゆえ本厄の年に「厄祓い」・「厄除け」を行い、神仏の加護を受けて凶事や災難を未然に防ぐ慣習がある。
sen.e: This is why people practice "yakubarai" (exorcism of bad luck) or "yakuyoke" (avoidance of bad luck) at their ages of calamity, in order to pre-empt adversity or misfortune by the help of Shinto and Buddhist deities.

This is why people practice "yakubarai" (exorcism of bad luck) or "yakuyoke" (avoidance of bad luck) at their ages of calamity, in order to pre-empt adversity or misfortune by the help of Shinto and Buddhist deities.

This is why people practice 'yakubarai' (exorcism of bad luck) or 'yakuyoke' (avoidance of bad luck) at their ages of calamity, in order to pre-empt adversity or misfortune by the help of Shinto and Buddhist deities.

sen.j: また、凶事が起こらなくとも、大厄の年齢では肉体的にも体力の低下や反射神経の鈍化など、衰退が顕著になる時期でもある。
sen.e: Even if nothing bad happens, physical deterioration may manifest itself as decreased strength or slower reflex at the ages of major calamity.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Even if nothing bad happens, physical deterioration may manifest itself as decreased strength or slower reflex at the ages of major calamity.
Even if nothing bad happens, physical deterioration may manifest itself as decreased strength or slower reflex at the ages of major calamity.

sen.j: 健康管理などの面でも注意が要される年頃でもあるともいう。
sen.e: People of the ages may need to pay more attention to their health.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: People of these ages may need to pay more attention to their health.
People of these ages may need to pay more attention to their health.

sen.j: なお広義の厄年に、七五三を含める地方もある。
sen.e: In some places, the ages of shichigosan (a celebration for three-year, five-year and seven-year old children) are also included in the calamitous ages in their broadest sense.
In some places, the ages of shichigosan (a celebration for three-year, five-year and seven-year old children) are also included in the calamitous ages in their broadest sense.
In some places, the ages of shichigosan (a celebration for three-year, five-year and seven-year old children) are also included in the calamitous ages in their broadest sense.

sen.j: この場合男性女性ともに厄年の最少年齢は3歳（数え年）になる。
sen.e: In this case the earliest age of calamity is the age of three (in Japanese age reckoning) for both men and women.
In this case the earliest age of calamity is the age of three (in Japanese age reckoning) for both men and women.
In this case the earliest age of calamity is the age of three (in Japanese age reckoning) for both men and women.

sen.j: 厄年のような考え方は、陰陽道や神道、仏教が伝わった国だけのものではない。
sen.e: The notion of the age of calamity is not limited to countries where the traditions of Yin and Yang divination and astronomy, Shinto or Buddhism have been spread.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The notion of the age of calamity is not limited to countries where the traditions of Yin and Yang divination and astronomy, Shinto or Buddhism have been spread.
The notion of the age of calamity is not limited to countries where the traditions of Yin and Yang divination and astronomy, Shinto or Buddhism have been spread.

sen.j: イギリスやスペインといったキリスト教国、エジプトやトルコといったイスラム教国にも同じような風習がある。
sen.e: It is also found in Christian countries like Britain and Spain and in Islamic countries such as Egypt and Turkey.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is also found in Christian countries like Britain and Spain and in Islamic countries such as Egypt and Turkey.
It is also found in Christian countries like Britain and Spain and in Islamic countries such as Egypt and Turkey.

sen.j: また、地方に幅広く根付く風習でもあるため、単純に厄除け参りを行うだけではなく、地域を挙げての行事として祭りのように祝う事もある。
sen.e: Widespread and well-established in each region, it ranges from simple pilgrimage for the purpose of avoiding bad luck to a community-wide celebration.
Widespread and well-established in each region, it ranges from simple pilgrimage for the purpose of avoiding bad luck to a community-wide celebration.
Widespread and well-established in each region, it ranges from simple pilgrimage for the purpose of avoiding bad luck to a community-wide celebration.

sen.j: このほか、厄年の数え方も25歳を「五五の厄年」など掛け算にするなどの風習もある。
sen.e: There is also a custom of counting calamitous ages by multiplication: the age of twenty-five expressed as "a calamitous age of five times five."
There is also a custom of counting calamitous ages by multiplication: the age of twenty-five expressed as "a calamitous age of five times five."
There is also a custom of counting calamitous ages by multiplication: the age of 25 expressed as 'a calamitous age of five times five.'
